texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["This page includes contact information for all TfL services. For general enquiries, contact Customer Services."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

Contact Customer Services for all ticket enquiries including Oyster and contactless payment, travel information queries and journey planning on all methods of transport including roads. We can also help with lost property and complaints.
Search common questions or contact us online
You can reach all the departments below on this number but please note their opening hours:

Travel Information and Journey Planning enquiries for all modes (24 hours)
London Underground enquiries (08:00-20:00 seven days a week)
DLR enquiries (08:00-20:00 seven days a week) - Contact DLR online
Buses enquiries (08:00-20:00 Monday to Friday)
Street enquiries (24 hours)
Emirates Air Line (08:00-20:00 seven days a week)
Lost Property (08:30-16:00 Monday to Friday)

Textphone: 0800 112 3456
Fax: 0343 222 6000
Post:
TfL Customer Services
4th Floor
14 Pier Walk
London SE10 0ES

Our Customer Services number also offers an automated service for A-to-B journeys. Just give the start and end point of any journey, and it will give you the quickest route. It can even text the journey details to your mobile phone.
If your journey is complicated, involves multiple locations or you have special requirements, you can still speak to one of our travel advisers.

If you request a text message, the average journey will usually be sent within a single message, however more complex journeys may take up to a maximum of two messages, charged at the price of a standard rate message.
For concerns or queries about the impact of Tube works on your home or business:

All London Underground lines: 0343 222 2424 *
Tottenham Court Road station project or Crossrail: helpdesk@crossrail.co.uk
